If the purpose the object was designed for ceases to exist, we cannot say the object was not designed: it was designed for a purpose that once existed.

1053998828095967233.text: If the created object serves no purpose—no need or desire—, then it is not designed, for design responds to & is shaped by purpose.

e.g.:

1053998823486509056.text:
but only that a human perceives it and undertakes the tasks of designing something to fittingly address it.
